sentences: Töötab päeval kell kaheksa kuni viis.
Päeval on ilus käia parkis jalutamas.
context: The word 'päeval' is an Estonian adverb that means 'during the day' or 'in the daytime'. It's in the adessive case (illative or inessive form) of the noun 'päev', which means 'day'. This case form indicates location or time when something happens. The word shows how Estonian uses different grammatical cases to express temporal concepts - here the adessive case is used to specify when an action occurs rather than where it occurs.
